title.narrative: Collaborative Research Program under the USAID-ARS Participating Agency Service Agreement (PASA)

description.narrative: USDA's Agricultural Research Service provides expertise and resources to develop health-enhancing snacks and other products using plantain (Musa paradisiaca ) and cowpea (Vigna sinensis) which are carbohydrate and protein staples in Ghana (CSIR) and many sub-Sahara African countries

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agricultural Research Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: Under the Tuskegee - APHIS Cooperative Agreement for international capacity building, Tuskegee University conducted a two-week advanced Risk Analysis workshop for participants from several countries in West Africa. This workshop built on the first basic Risk Analysis workshop conducted in August 2010. This workshop was held at the Erata Hotel in Accra, Ghana. The objective of the workshop was to deepen the understanding and practice related to Risk Analysis as it relates to specific agricultural commodities that the representative countries in the workshop are interested in trading. One representative from APHIS PPD attended the workshop.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

transaction.usg:treasury-account: State and Private Forestry, Forest Service

title.narrative: Workshop for key stakeholders on The control of Avian Influenza and other emerging diseases

description.narrative: From February 1-17, 2016, The USDA Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS), International Technical and Regulatory Capacity Building (ITRCB) Center coordinated with Ghana Directorate of Veterinary Services (Ministry of Food and Agriculture) on The control of Avian Influenza and other emerging diseases. The workshop aimed to provide Ghana Avian Influenza response teams with practical tools to address HPAI (H5N1) outbreaks in Ghana that directly affect the poultry industry and threaten public health.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Ghana - Practical Tools for Phytosanitary Inspection and Sampling

description.narrative: This workshop reviewed and discussed plant pests surveillance, diagnosis capacities, control and reporting systems in the region, and identified avenues to promote plant pest monitoring systems in West Africa.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Poultry diseases detection, Biosecurity in Farms/Live birds Markets/Sampling procedures for lab tests.

description.narrative: From August 23-26, 2016, the Poultry Disease Detection, Biosecurity in Farms and Live Bird Markets was held in Ghana. With objectives to strengthen the capacity of laboratory technicians and field epidemiologists on poultry diseases surveillance, diagnostic tools and improved biosecurity procedures in poultry farms and live birds markets the workshop began with each country providing an update on HPAI and other poultry disease surveillance and prevention activities.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Workshop on Sampling procedures and Diagnosis techniques of PPR

description.narrative: From September 18-23, 2016, the Sampling Procedures and Diagnosis Techniques of PPR Workshop was held in Ghana. The training was organized by USDA-APHIS Dakar in cooperation with Accra Veterinary Laboratory. The program aimed at assisting countries in the region, to improve their capabilities to detect PPR, through a training of laboratory technicians on proven PPR sampling techniques, ELISA-based diagnostic tests and RT-PCR.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: USDA provides support to the Economic Growth (EG) section of the USAID Ghana Mission for program management and technical services under a Participating Agency Service Agreement (PASA). This activity provides additional support to the management unit of the USAID/Ghana Mission under the Initiative to End Hunger in Africa (IEHA), as well as other services to support the mission's EG office in the performance of its functions relating to program design, monitoring and evaluation, and as needed, technical services for policy, regulatory reform, and training for increased agricultural growth and food security in Ghana.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

title.narrative: Faculty Exchange Program - Africa Veterinary Medicine

description.narrative: The Faculty Exchange Program enhances the teaching ability of agricultural educators from institutions of higher learning in developing countries. Participants come to the United States for one academic semester (4-5 months) to increase their knowledge of, and ability to teach, agricultural economics, marketing, business and law in a market-based economy.

title.narrative: Scientific Cooperation Research Program - Soybean Value Chain

description.narrative: The Scientific Cooperation Research Program supports joint research, extension, and education projects lasting up to two years among domestic and international agricultural professionals.
